labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issues.title: Draft name needs to conform to IETF pattern
issues.author: alvestrand
issues.body:
Draft name should be draft-ietf-mediaman-6838bis - this can wait until we have formally adopted the document.

(Was surprised to see this come out without an -authorname- component)

issues.title: Incorporate -toplevel
issues.author: alvestrand
issues.body:
The content of [-toplevel ](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-mediaman-toplevel/) needs to be incorporated in 6838bis.
The historical portions can probably be left in the published RFC, which 6838bis will obsolete.

issues.title: Incorporate -suffixes
issues.author: alvestrand
issues.body:
The content of [-suffixes ](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-mediaman-suffixes/) needs to be incorporated into 6838bis.
The current text is deemed to represent WG consensus, but wordsmithing is expected.

issues.title: Incorporate -standards-tree
issues.author: alvestrand
issues.body: The content of [-standards-tree](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-mediaman-standards-tree/) is deemed to represent rough consensus in the WG, and should be incorporated in 6838bis.

issues.title: Cleanup for "additional information" in media type registration
issues.author: alvestrand
issues.body:
From Paul Libbrecht:

Just a reminder: if we update RFC 6838 then it would be cool to:

*    remove “Macintosh file type code(s)” (which doesn’t exist anymore since MacOSX)
*    add “Windows clipboard flavour” and “macOS Universal Type Identifier” among the additional information fields.

comments.author: polx
alvestrand
comments.body:
The RFC Editors page at https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc6838 seems to not list one. The RFC predates the universal presence of XML formats.

There's an XML format on the I-D page for the last-before-publication I-D: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-appsawg-media-type-regs/14/

I think either Tony Hansen or John Klensin might have one too.

comments.author: polx
comments.body:
OK. So here would be a patch and the resulting XML compared to [the last-before-publication I-D](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-appsawg-media-type-regs/14/):

In substance:
- replace the suggestion to the MacOS file type by the suggestions for macOS UTIs and Windows clipboard flavor names
- replace the literature entry of MacOS file type (which was 21 y old and whose URL is no longer available, an [archive fetch](https://web.archive.org/web/20080517021842/http://www.info.apple.com/kbnum/n55381) exists still) by an explanation of the macOS UTIs and windows clipboard flavors.

Is this enough for an inclusion? 
Should this be more text-oriented to be included in a new RFC?
Or should the RFC 6838 be made into a newer document, maybe together with the mediaman release?

thanks in advance.
Paul

* [add-clipboard-flavor-names.patch](https://github.com/ietf-wg-mediaman/procedures/files/14473152/add-clipboard-flavor-names.patch)
* The resulting XML file is called `.txt` since GitHub considereds XML unsupported (LOL):  [draft-ietf-appsawg-media-type-regs-14.xml.txt](https://github.com/ietf-wg-mediaman/procedures/files/14473159/draft-ietf-appsawg-media-type-regs-14.xml.txt)

issues.title: Appeal procedure could be more crisp
issues.author: alvestrand
issues.body: The appeal procedure is borrowed from 2026. It may not be the right procedure.

issues.title: Grandfathering requirements should apply to all unregistered media-types
issues.author: CxRes
issues.body:
I find that the text in paragraph 2 of Appendix A is only targeting unfaceted subtypes that should be registered as faceted. There are unregistered or improperly registered unfaceted subtypes that might need to re-registered as unfaceted. Such as media-types mentioned in https://github.com/ietf-wg-mediaman/procedures/issues/6.

This text should therefore RECOMMEND that in all cases where the media-types are unregistered, missing a registration template or have unstructured templates, they should be re-registered if possible.
